4907 std::array<double, 3> PatchKernel::evalElementCentroid(const Element &element) const
4908 {
4909  ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
4910  std::size_t nCellVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
4911  BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(vertexCoordinates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nCellVertices, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_VERTICES);
4912  getVertexCoords(nCellVertices, elementVertexIds.data(), vertexCoordinates);
4913 
4914  return element.evalCentroid(vertexCoordinates);
4915 }
4916 
4924 void PatchKernel::evalElementBoundingBox(const Element &element, std::array<double,3> *minPoint, std::array<double,3> *maxPoint) const
4925 {
4926  ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
4927  const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
4928 
4929  *minPoint = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[0]);
4930  *maxPoint = *minPoint;
4931  for (int i = 1; i < nElementVertices; ++i) {
4932  const std::array<double, 3> &vertexCoord = getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds[i]);
4933  for (int d = 0; d < 3; ++d) {
4934  (*minPoint)[d] = std::min(vertexCoord[d], (*minPoint)[d]);
4935  (*maxPoint)[d] = std::max(vertexCoord[d], (*maxPoint)[d]);
4936  }
4937  }
4938 }
4939 
4952 long PatchKernel::locatePoint(double x, double y, double z) const
4953 {
4954  return locatePoint({{x, y, z}});
4955 }
4956 
4967 bool PatchKernel::isSameFace(long cellId_A, int face_A, long cellId_B, int face_B) const
4968 {
4969  const Cell &cell_A = m_cells[cellId_A];
4970  const Cell &cell_B = m_cells[cellId_B];
4971  if (cell_A.getFaceType(face_A) != cell_B.getFaceType(face_B)) {
4972  return false;
4973  }
4974 
4975  int nFaceVertices = cell_A.getFaceVertexCount(face_A);
4976 
4977  std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_A(nFaceVertices);
4978  std::vector<long> faceVertexIds_B(nFaceVertices);
4979  for (int k = 0; k < nFaceVertices; ++k) {
4980  faceVertexIds_A[k] = cell_A.getFaceVertexId(face_A, k);
4981  faceVertexIds_B[k] = cell_B.getFaceVertexId(face_B, k);
4982  }
4983 
4984  std::sort(faceVertexIds_A.begin(), faceVertexIds_A.end());
4985  std::sort(faceVertexIds_B.begin(), faceVertexIds_B.end());
4986 
4987  return (faceVertexIds_A == faceVertexIds_B);
4988 }
4989 
4995 PatchKernel::AdjacenciesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() const
4996 {
4997  return m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy;
4998 }
4999 
5005 void PatchKernel::setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy status)
5006 {
5007  m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy = status;
5008 }
5009 
5017 bool PatchKernel::areAdjacenciesDirty(bool global) const
5018 {
5019  if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5020  return false;
5021  }
5022 
5023  bool areDirty = false;
5024  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5025  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5026  if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5027  areDirty = true;
5028  break;
5029  }
5030  }
5031 
5032 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
5033  if (global && isPartitioned()) {
5034  const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
5035  MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
5036  }
5037 #else
5038  BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
5039 #endif
5040 
5041  return areDirty;
5042 }
5043 
5050 void PatchKernel::buildAdjacencies()
5051 {
5052  initializeAdjacencies(ADJACENCIES_AUTOMATIC);
5053 }
5054 
5063 void PatchKernel::initializeAdjacencies(AdjacenciesBuildStrategy strategy)
5064 {
5065  // Initialize build strategy
5066  AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5067  if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
5068  // Reset adjacencies
5069  if (currentStrategy != ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5070  destroyAdjacencies();
5071  }
5072 
5073  // Set adjacencies strategy
5074  setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(strategy);
5075  }
5076 
5077  // Update the adjacencies
5078  setCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5079  updateAdjacencies();
5080 }
5081 
5088 void PatchKernel::updateAdjacencies(bool forcedUpdated)
5089 {
5090  // Early return if adjacencies are not built
5091  AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5092  if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5093  return;
5094  }
5095 
5096  // Check if the adjacencies are dirty
5097  bool adjacenciesDirty = areAdjacenciesDirty();
5098  if (!adjacenciesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
5099  return;
5100  }
5101 
5102  // Update adjacencies
5103  if (adjacenciesDirty) {
5104  // Prune stale adjacencies
5105  pruneStaleAdjacencies();
5106 
5107  // Update adjacencies
5108  _updateAdjacencies();
5109 
5110  // Adjacencies are now updated
5111  unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5112  } else {
5113  initializeAdjacencies(currentStrategy);
5114  }
5115 }
5116 
5123 void PatchKernel::destroyAdjacencies()
5124 {
5125  // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5126  if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5127  return;
5128  }
5129 
5130  // Reset the adjacencies
5131  _resetAdjacencies();
5132 
5133  // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
5134  unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5135 
5136  // Set adjacencies status
5137  setAdjacenciesBuildStrategy(ADJACENCIES_NONE);
5138 }
5139 
5146 void PatchKernel::resetAdjacencies()
5147 {
5148  // Early return if no adjacencies have been built
5149  if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5150  return;
5151  }
5152 
5153  // Reset adjacencies
5154  _resetAdjacencies();
5155 
5156  // All cells have now dirty adjacencies
5157  setCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY);
5158 }
5159 
5165 void PatchKernel::_resetAdjacencies()
5166 {
5167  for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
5168  cell.resetAdjacencies();
5169  }
5170 }
5171 
5178 void PatchKernel::pruneStaleAdjacencies()
5179 {
5180  // Early return if adjacencies are not built
5181  AdjacenciesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy();
5182  if (currentStrategy == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5183  return;
5184  }
5185 
5186  // Update cell adjacencies
5187  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5188  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5189  if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5190  continue;
5191  }
5192 
5193  long cellId = entry.first;
5194  Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5195  int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5196  for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
5197  long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
5198  int nFaceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
5199  for (int i = nFaceAdjacencies - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5200  long adjacency = faceAdjacencies[i];
5201  if (!testCellAlterationFlags(adjacency, FLAG_DELETED)) {
5202  continue;
5203  }
5204 
5205  cell.deleteAdjacency(face, i);
5206  }
5207  }
5208  }
5209 }
5210 
5219 void PatchKernel::_updateAdjacencies()
5220 {
5221  // The adjacencies are found looking for matching half-faces.
5222  //
5223  // On a three-dimensional patch each internal face is shared between two,
5224  // and only two, half-faces. On lower dimension patches one internal face
5225  // may be shared among multiple half-faces (this happend with non-manifold
5226  // patches).
5227  //
5228  // If faces can be shared only between two half-faces, there is a one-to-one
5229  // correspondence between the half-faces. Give one half-faces, its matching
5230  // can be found looking for an half-faces with the same vertices but with
5231  // reverse vertex winding order.
5232  //
5233  // If faces can be shared among more than two half-faces, it's not anymore
5234  // possible to define a unique winding order for the vertices of the faces.
5235  // There is no more a one-to-one correspondence between pairs of half-face.
5236  // In this case, when looking for half-face correspondence, it is necessary
5237  // to look for half-faces with reverse vertex winding order and also for
5238  // half-faces with the same vertex winding order.
5239  //
5240  // If we are updating the adjacencies of only part of the cells, we need
5241  // to populate the half-face list with the faces of the cells that will
5242  // not be updated (among those faces may find matches for the faces of
5243  // the updated cells). If faces can be shared only between two half-faces
5244  // we need to insert only the border faces of the non-updated cells,
5245  // otherwise we need to add all the faces of the non-updated cells.
5246 
5247  // Define matching windings
5248  bool multipleMatchesAllowed = (getDimension() < 3);
5249 
5250  std::vector<CellHalfFace::Winding> matchingWindings;
5251  matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_REVERSE);
5252  if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
5253  matchingWindings.push_back(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
5254  }
5255 
5256  // Count cells with dirty adjacencies
5257  long nDirtyAdjacenciesCells = 0;
5258  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5259  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5260  if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5261  continue;
5262  }
5263 
5264  ++nDirtyAdjacenciesCells;
5265  }
5266 
5267  // Initialize half-faces list
5268  std::unordered_multiset<CellHalfFace, CellHalfFace::Hasher> halfFaces;
5269  if (multipleMatchesAllowed) {
5270  halfFaces.reserve(4 * getCellCount());
5271  } else {
5272  halfFaces.reserve(2 * nDirtyAdjacenciesCells);
5273  }
5274 
5275  // Populate list with faces of non-updated cells
5276  if ((long) nDirtyAdjacenciesCells != getCellCount()) {
5277  for (Cell &cell : m_cells) {
5278  if (testCellAlterationFlags(cell.getId(), FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5279  continue;
5280  }
5281 
5282  int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5283  for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
5284  if (multipleMatchesAllowed || cell.isFaceBorder(face)) {
5285  halfFaces.emplace(cell, face, CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
5286  }
5287  }
5288  }
5289  }
5290 
5291  // Update the adjacencies
5292  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5293  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5294  if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_ADJACENCIES_DIRTY)) {
5295  continue;
5296  }
5297 
5298  long cellId = entry.first;
5299  Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5300 
5301  const int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5302  for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
5303  // Generate the half-face
5304  CellHalfFace halfFace(cell, face);
5305 
5306  // Find matching half-faces
5307  int nAdjacencies = 0;
5308  for (CellHalfFace::Winding winding : matchingWindings) {
5309  // Set winding order
5310  halfFace.setWinding(winding);
5311 
5312  // Search for matching half-faces
5313  //
5314  // Each match is adjacent to the current half-face.
5315  auto matchRange = halfFaces.equal_range(halfFace);
5316  for (auto matchItr = matchRange.first; matchItr != matchRange.second; ++matchItr) {
5317  const CellHalfFace &neighHalfFace = *matchItr;
5318 
5319  // Generate the adjacency
5320  //
5321  // The function that adds the adjacencies to a cell takes
5322  // care of checking if the adjacency already exists.
5323  Cell &neigh = neighHalfFace.getCell();
5324  long neighId = neigh.getId();
5325  long neighFace = neighHalfFace.getFace();
5326 
5327  cell.pushAdjacency(face, neighId);
5328  neigh.pushAdjacency(neighFace, cellId);
5329 
5330  ++nAdjacencies;
5331  }
5332 
5333  // Remove the matching half-faces from the list
5334  //
5335  // It is not possible to remove the matching half-faces
5336  // if multiple matches are allowed.
5337  if (!multipleMatchesAllowed) {
5338  halfFaces.erase(matchRange.first, matchRange.second);
5339  }
5340  }
5341 
5342  // Add the current half-face to the list.
5343  //
5344  // If no multiple matches are allowed, we need to add the current
5345  // half-face to the list only if no matchings were found.
5346  if (multipleMatchesAllowed || nAdjacencies == 0) {
5347  halfFace.setWinding(CellHalfFace::WINDING_NATURAL);
5348  halfFaces.insert(std::move(halfFace));
5349  }
5350  }
5351  }
5352 }
5353 
5359 PatchKernel::InterfacesBuildStrategy PatchKernel::getInterfacesBuildStrategy() const
5360 {
5361  return m_interfacesBuildStrategy;
5362 }
5363 
5369 void PatchKernel::setInterfacesBuildStrategy(InterfacesBuildStrategy status)
5370 {
5371  m_interfacesBuildStrategy = status;
5372 }
5373 
5381 bool PatchKernel::areInterfacesDirty(bool global) const
5382 {
5383  if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
5384  return false;
5385  }
5386 
5387  bool areDirty = !m_alteredInterfaces.empty();
5388  if (!areDirty) {
5389  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5390  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5391  if (testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
5392  areDirty = true;
5393  break;
5394  }
5395  }
5396  }
5397 
5398 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
5399  if (global && isPartitioned()) {
5400  const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
5401  MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, &areDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
5402  }
5403 #else
5404  BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
5405 #endif
5406 
5407  return areDirty;
5408 }
5409 
5416 void PatchKernel::buildInterfaces()
5417 {
5418  initializeInterfaces(INTERFACES_AUTOMATIC);
5419 }
5420 
5432 void PatchKernel::initializeInterfaces(InterfacesBuildStrategy strategy)
5433 {
5434  // Interfaces need adjacencies
5435  if (getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() == ADJACENCIES_NONE) {
5436  throw std::runtime_error ("Adjacencies are mandatory for building the interfaces.");
5437  }
5438 
5439  // Initialize build strategy
5440  InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
5441  if (currentStrategy != strategy) {
5442  // Reset interfaces
5443  if (currentStrategy != INTERFACES_NONE) {
5444  destroyInterfaces();
5445  }
5446 
5447  // Set interfaces strategy
5448  setInterfacesBuildStrategy(strategy);
5449  }
5450 
5451  // Update the interfaces
5452  setCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
5453  updateInterfaces();
5454 }
5455 
5462 void PatchKernel::updateInterfaces(bool forcedUpdated)
5463 {
5464  // Early return if interfaces are not built
5465  InterfacesBuildStrategy currentStrategy = getInterfacesBuildStrategy();
5466  if (currentStrategy == INTERFACES_NONE) {
5467  return;
5468  }
5469 
5470  // Check if the interfaces are dirty
5471  bool interfacesDirty = areInterfacesDirty();
5472  if (!interfacesDirty && !forcedUpdated) {
5473  return;
5474  }
5475 
5476  // Interfaces need up-to-date adjacencies
5477  assert(getAdjacenciesBuildStrategy() != ADJACENCIES_NONE);
5478  updateAdjacencies();
5479 
5480  // Update interfaces
5481  if (interfacesDirty) {
5482  // Enable advanced editing
5483  bool originalExpertStatus = isExpert();
5484  setExpert(true);
5485 
5486  // Prune stale interfaces
5487  pruneStaleInterfaces();
5488 
5489  // Update interfaces
5490  _updateInterfaces();
5491 
5492  // Interfaces are now updated
5493  unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
5494  m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
5495 
5496  // Set original advanced editing status
5497  setExpert(originalExpertStatus);
5498  } else {
5499  initializeInterfaces(currentStrategy);
5500  }
5501 }
5502 
5509 void PatchKernel::destroyInterfaces()
5510 {
5511  // Early return if no interfaces have been built
5512  if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
5513  return;
5514  }
5515 
5516  // Reset the interfaces
5517  _resetInterfaces();
5518 
5519  // Clear list of cells with dirty adjacencies
5520  unsetCellAlterationFlags(FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY);
5521 
5522  // Clear list of altered interfaces
5523  m_alteredInterfaces.clear();
5524 
5525  // Set interface build strategy
5526  setInterfacesBuildStrategy(INTERFACES_NONE);
5527 }
5528 
5535 void PatchKernel::pruneStaleInterfaces()
5536 {
5537  // Early return if no interfaces have been built
5538  if (getInterfacesBuildStrategy() == INTERFACES_NONE) {
5539  return;
5540  }
5541 
5542  // Update cell interfaces
5543  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5544  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5545  if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
5546  continue;
5547  }
5548 
5549  long cellId = entry.first;
5550  Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5551  int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5552  for (int face = nCellFaces - 1; face >= 0; --face) {
5553  long *faceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaces(face);
5554  int nFaceInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
5555  for (int i = nFaceInterfaces - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
5556  long interfaceId = faceInterfaces[i];
5557  if (!testInterfaceAlterationFlags(interfaceId, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
5558  continue;
5559  }
5560 
5561  // Delete the interface from the cell
5562  cell.deleteInterface(face, i);
5563  }
5564  }
5565  }
5566 
5567  // Delete dangling interfaces
5568  std::vector<long> danglingInterfaces;
5569  danglingInterfaces.reserve(m_alteredInterfaces.size());
5570  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredInterfaces) {
5571  AlterationFlags interfaceAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5572  if (!testAlterationFlags(interfaceAlterationFlags, FLAG_DANGLING)) {
5573  continue;
5574  }
5575 
5576  long interfaceId = entry.first;
5577  danglingInterfaces.push_back(interfaceId);
5578  }
5579  deleteInterfaces(danglingInterfaces);
5580 }
5581 
5588 void PatchKernel::_updateInterfaces()
5589 {
5590  //
5591  // Update interfaces
5592  //
5593  // Adjacencies and interfaces of a face are paired: the i-th face adjacency
5594  // corresponds to the i-th face interface. Moreover if we loop through the
5595  // adjacencies of a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always
5596  // listed first. This meas that, to update the interfaces, we can count the
5597  // interfaces already associated to a face and loop only on the adjacencies
5598  // which have an index past the one of the last interface.
5599  //
5600  // On border faces of internal cells we need to build an interface, also
5601  // if there are no adjacencies.
5602  for (const auto &entry : m_alteredCells) {
5603  AlterationFlags cellAlterationFlags = entry.second;
5604  if (!testAlterationFlags(cellAlterationFlags, FLAG_INTERFACES_DIRTY)) {
5605  continue;
5606  }
5607 
5608  long cellId = entry.first;
5609  Cell &cell = m_cells.at(cellId);
5610  const int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
5611  for (int face = 0; face < nCellFaces; face++) {
5612  int nFaceInterfaces= cell.getInterfaceCount(face);
5613 
5614  bool isFaceBorder = cell.isFaceBorder(face);
5615  if (!isFaceBorder) {
5616  // Find the range of adjacencies that need an interface
5617  int updateEnd = cell.getAdjacencyCount(face);
5618  int updateBegin = nFaceInterfaces;
5619  if (updateBegin == updateEnd) {
5620  continue;
5621  }
5622 
5623  // Build an interface for every adjacency
5624  const long *faceAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies(face);
5625  for (int k = updateBegin; k < updateEnd; ++k) {
5626  long neighId = faceAdjacencies[k];
5627  Cell *neigh = &m_cells[neighId];
5628 
5629  int neighFace = findAdjoinNeighFace(cellId, face, neighId);
5630 
5631  buildCellInterface(&cell, face, neigh, neighFace);
5632  }
5633  } else if (nFaceInterfaces == 0) {
5634  // Internal borderes need an interface
5635  buildCellInterface(&cell, face, nullptr, -1);
5636  }
5637  }
5638  }
5639 }
5640 
5655 PatchKernel::InterfaceIterator PatchKernel::buildCellInterface(Cell *cell_1, int face_1, Cell *cell_2, int face_2, long interfaceId)
5656 {
5657  // Validate the input
5658  assert(cell_1);
5659  assert(face_1 >= 0);
5660 
5661  if (cell_2) {
5662  assert(face_2 >= 0);
5663  } else {
5664  assert(face_2 < 0);
5665  }
5666 
5667  // Get the id of the first cell
5668  long id_1 = cell_1->getId();
5669 
5670  // Get the id of the second cell
5671  long id_2 = Cell::NULL_ID;
5672  if (cell_2) {
5673  id_2 = cell_2->getId();
5674  }
5675 
5676  // Owner and neighbour of the interface
5677  //
5678  // The interface is owned by the cell that has only one adjacency, i.e.,
5679  // by the cell that owns the smallest of the two faces. If the faces
5680  // of both cells have the same size, the interface is owned by the cell
5681  // with the "lower fuzzy positioning". It is not necessary to have a
5682  // precise comparison, it's only necessary to define a repeatable order
5683  // between the two cells. It is therefore possible to use the "fuzzy"
5684  // cell comparison.
5685  bool cellOwnsInterface = true;
5686  if (cell_2) {
5687  if (cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) > 1) {
5688  cellOwnsInterface = false;
5689  } else if (cell_2->getAdjacencyCount(face_2) == 1) {
5690  assert(cell_1->getAdjacencyCount(face_1) == 1);
5691  cellOwnsInterface = CellFuzzyPositionLess(*this)(id_1, id_2);
5692  }
5693  }
5694 
5695  Cell *intrOwner;
5696  Cell *intrNeigh;
5697  long intrOwnerId;
5698  long intrNeighId;
5699  int intrOwnerFace;
5700  int intrNeighFace;
5701  if (cellOwnsInterface) {
5702  intrOwnerId = id_1;
5703  intrOwner = cell_1;
5704  intrOwnerFace = face_1;
5705 
5706  if (cell_2) {
5707  intrNeighId = id_2;
5708  intrNeigh = cell_2;
5709  intrNeighFace = face_2;
5710  } else {
5711  intrNeighId = Cell::NULL_ID;
5712  intrNeigh = nullptr;
5713  intrNeighFace = -1;
5714  }
5715  } else {
5716  intrOwnerId = id_2;
5717  intrOwner = cell_2;
5718  intrOwnerFace = face_2;
5719 
5720  intrNeighId = id_1;
5721  intrNeigh = cell_1;
5722  intrNeighFace = face_1;
5723  }
5724 
5725  // Connectivity of the interface
5726  ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = intrOwner->getFaceConnect(intrOwnerFace);
5727 
5728  int nInterfaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
5729  std::unique_ptr<long[]> interfaceConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nInterfaceVertices]);
5730  for (int k = 0; k < nInterfaceVertices; ++k) {
5731  interfaceConnect[k] = faceConnect[k];
5732  }
5733 
5734  // Create the interface
5735  Interface *interface;
5736  InterfaceIterator interfaceIterator;
5737 
5738  ElementType interfaceType = intrOwner->getFaceType(intrOwnerFace);
5739  if (interfaceId < 0) {
5740  interfaceIterator = addInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
5741  interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
5742  interfaceId = interface->getId();
5743  } else {
5744  interfaceIterator = restoreInterface(interfaceType, std::move(interfaceConnect), interfaceId);
5745  interface = &(*interfaceIterator);
5746  }
5747 
5748  // Set owner and neighbour
5749  interface->setOwner(intrOwnerId, intrOwnerFace);
5750  if (intrNeighId >= 0) {
5751  interface->setNeigh(intrNeighId, intrNeighFace);
5752  }
5753 
5754  // Update owner and neighbour cell data
5755  //
5756  // Adjacencies and interfaces are paired: the i-th adjacency correspondes
5757  // to the i-th interface. Moreover if we loop through the adjacencies of
5758  // a face, the adjacencies that have an interface are always listed first.
5759  // When the interfaces are fully built, each adjacency is associated to an
5760  // interface, however this will not be true during the generation of the
5761  // interfaces. If the adjacencies already associated to an interface are
5762  // listed first, it will be easy to detect which interfaces are still to
5763  // be built: the missing interfaces are associated to the adjacencies which
5764  // have an index past the last interface.
5765  //
5766  // The above only matters if the neighbour cell exists, if there is no
5767  // neighbour there will be only one interface on that face, so there are
5768  // no ordering issues.
5769  intrOwner->pushInterface(intrOwnerFace, interfaceId);
5770  if (intrNeigh) {
5771  intrNeigh->pushInterface(intrNeighFace, interfaceId);
5772 
5773  // Fix adjacency order on the owner cell
5774  int ownerInterfaceIndex = intrOwner->getInterfaceCount(intrOwnerFace) - 1;
5775  long ownerPairedAdjacency = intrOwner->getAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex);
5776  if (ownerPairedAdjacency != intrNeighId) {
5777  int ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrOwner->findAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, intrNeighId);
5778  assert(ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
5779  intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerInterfaceIndex, intrNeighId);
5780  intrOwner->setAdjacency(intrOwnerFace, ownerPairedAdjacencyIndex, ownerPairedAdjacency);
5781  }
5782 
5783  // Fix adjacency order on the neighbour cell
5784  int neighInterfaceIndex = intrNeigh->getInterfaceCount(intrNeighFace) - 1;
5785  long neighPairedAdjacency = intrNeigh->getAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex);
5786  if (neighPairedAdjacency != intrOwnerId) {
5787  int neighPairedAdjacencyIndex = intrNeigh->findAdjacency(intrNeighFace, intrOwnerId);
5788  assert(neighPairedAdjacencyIndex >= 0);
5789  intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighInterfaceIndex, intrOwnerId);
5790  intrNeigh->setAdjacency(intrNeighFace, neighPairedAdjacencyIndex, neighPairedAdjacency);
5791  }
5792  }
5793 
5794  return interfaceIterator;
5795 }
5796 
5806 int PatchKernel::findAdjoinNeighFace(long cellId, int cellFace, long neighId) const
5807 {
5808  // Evaluate list of candidate faces
5809  //
5810  // The cells may be neighbours through multiple faces. Identify which face
5811  // matches the target one is quite expensive. Moreover, if the cells are
5812  // neighbours through a single face (which is the common case), the check
5813  // is not needed at all. Therefore, first we identify all the faces through
5814  // which the two cells are neighbours and then, if and only if there are
5815  // multiple candidates, we identify the face that matches the target one.
5816  const Cell &neigh = getCell(neighId);
5817  const int nNeighFaces = neigh.getFaceCount();
5818 
5819  int nCandidates = 0;
5820  BITPIT_CREATE_WORKSPACE(candidates, std::array<double BITPIT_COMMA 3>, nNeighFaces, ReferenceElementInfo::MAX_ELEM_FACES);
5821  for (int neighFace = 0; neighFace < nNeighFaces; neighFace++) {
5822  int nFaceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencyCount(neighFace);
5823  const long *faceAdjacencies = neigh.getAdjacencies(neighFace);
5824  for (int k = 0; k < nFaceAdjacencies; ++k) {
5825  long geussId = faceAdjacencies[k];
5826  if (geussId == cellId) {
5827  (*candidates)[nCandidates] = neighFace;
5828  ++nCandidates;
5829  break;
5830  }
5831  }
5832  }
5833 
5834  // Select the face of the neighbour which adjoin the given face
5835  if (nCandidates == 1) {
5836  return (*candidates)[0];
5837  } else {
5838  for (int i = 0; i < nCandidates; ++i) {
5839  int candidateFace = (*candidates)[i];
5840  if (isSameFace(cellId, cellFace, neighId, candidateFace)) {
5841  return candidateFace;
5842  }
5843  }
5844  }
5845 
5846  return -1;
5847 }
5848 
5856 bool PatchKernel::testCellAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags) const
5857 {
5858  return testElementAlterationFlags(id, flags, m_alteredCells);
5859 }

6013 bool PatchKernel::testElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, const AlterationFlagsStorage &flagsStorage) const
6014 {
6015  auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage.find(id);
6016  if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage.end()) {
6017  return testAlterationFlags(storedFlagsItr->second, flags);
6018  } else {
6019  return testAlterationFlags(FLAG_NONE, flags);
6020  }
6021 }

6031 {

6033 }

6042 PatchKernel::AlterationFlags PatchKernel::getElementAlterationFlags(long id, const AlterationFlagsStorage &flagsStorage) const
6043 {

6045  if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage.end()) {
6046  return storedFlagsItr->second;

6059 void PatchKernel::resetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6060 {
6061  if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6062  flagsStorage->erase(id);
6063  } else {
6064  (*flagsStorage)[id] = flags;
6065  }
6066 }
6067 
6075 void PatchKernel::setElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6076 {
6077  if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6078  return;
6079  }
6080 
6081  auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
6082  if (storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end()) {
6083  storedFlagsItr->second |= flags;
6084  } else {
6085  flagsStorage->insert({id, flags});
6086  }
6087 }
6088 
6095 void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6096 {
6097  if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6098  return;
6099  }
6100 
6101  for (auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->begin(); storedFlagsItr != flagsStorage->end();) {
6102  storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
6103  if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
6104  storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
6105  } else {
6106  ++storedFlagsItr;
6107  }
6108  }
6109 }
6110 
6118 void PatchKernel::unsetElementAlterationFlags(long id, AlterationFlags flags, AlterationFlagsStorage *flagsStorage) const
6119 {
6120  if (flags == FLAG_NONE) {
6121  return;
6122  }
6123 
6124  auto storedFlagsItr = flagsStorage->find(id);
6125  if (storedFlagsItr == flagsStorage->end()) {
6126  return;
6127  }
6128 
6129  storedFlagsItr->second &= ~flags;
6130  if (storedFlagsItr->second == FLAG_NONE) {
6131  flagsStorage->erase(storedFlagsItr);
6132  }
6133 }
6134 
6140 void PatchKernel::clearBoundingBox()
6141 {
6142  for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
6143  m_boxMinPoint[k] = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
6144  m_boxMinCounter[k] = 0;
6145 
6146  m_boxMaxPoint[k] = - std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
6147  m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 0;
6148  }
6149 
6150  setBoundingBoxDirty(getCellCount() > 0);
6151 }
6152 
6161 void PatchKernel::setBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, const std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint)
6162 {
6163  m_boxMinPoint = minPoint;
6164  m_boxMaxPoint = maxPoint;
6165 
6166  setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
6167 }
6168 
6175 void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
6176 {
6177  getBoundingBox(false, minPoint, maxPoint);
6178 }
6179 
6188 void PatchKernel::getBoundingBox(bool global, std::array<double, 3> &minPoint, std::array<double, 3> &maxPoint) const
6189 {
6190  minPoint = m_boxMinPoint;
6191  maxPoint = m_boxMaxPoint;
6192 
6193 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6194  if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6195  MPI_Comm communicator = getCommunicator();
6196  MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, minPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MIN, communicator);
6197  MPI_Allreduce(MPI_IN_PLACE, maxPoint.data(), 3, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_MAX, communicator);
6198  }
6199 #else
6200  BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6201 #endif
6202 }
6203 
6209 bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxFrozen() const
6210 {
6211  return m_boxFrozen;
6212 }
6213 
6224 void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxFrozen(bool frozen)
6225 {
6226  m_boxFrozen = frozen;
6227 }
6228 
6236 bool PatchKernel::isBoundingBoxDirty(bool global) const
6237 {
6238  bool isDirty = m_boxDirty;
6239 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6240  if (global && isPartitioned()) {
6241  const auto &communicator = getCommunicator();
6242  MPI_Allreduce(const_cast<bool *>(&m_boxDirty), &isDirty, 1, MPI_C_BOOL, MPI_LOR, communicator);
6243  }
6244 #else
6245  BITPIT_UNUSED(global);
6246 #endif
6247 
6248  return isDirty;
6249 }
6250 
6256 void PatchKernel::setBoundingBoxDirty(bool dirty)
6257 {
6258  m_boxDirty = dirty;
6259 }
6260 
6267 void PatchKernel::updateBoundingBox(bool forcedUpdated)
6268 {
6269  if (isBoundingBoxFrozen()) {
6270  return;
6271  }
6272 
6273  // Check if the bounding box is dirty
6274  if (!isBoundingBoxDirty() && !forcedUpdated) {
6275  return;
6276  }
6277 
6278  // Initialize bounding box
6279  clearBoundingBox();
6280 
6281  // Unset the dirty flag in order to be able to update the bounding box
6282  setBoundingBoxDirty(false);
6283 
6284  // Compute bounding box
6285  for (const auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
6286  addPointToBoundingBox(vertex.getCoords());
6287  }
6288 }
6289 
6298 void PatchKernel::addPointToBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
6299 {
6300  if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
6301  return;
6302  }
6303 
6304  for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
6305  double value = point[k];
6306 
6307  // Update maximum value
6308  if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], getTol())) {
6309  ++m_boxMaxCounter[k];
6310  } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
6311  m_boxMaxPoint[k] = value;
6312  m_boxMaxCounter[k] = 1;
6313  }
6314 
6315  // Update minimum value
6316  if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], getTol())) {
6317  ++m_boxMinCounter[k];
6318  } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
6319  m_boxMinPoint[k] = value;
6320  m_boxMinCounter[k] = 1;
6321  }
6322  }
6323 }
6324 
6333 void PatchKernel::removePointFromBoundingBox(const std::array<double, 3> &point)
6334 {
6335  if (isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
6336  return;
6337  }
6338 
6339  for (size_t k = 0; k < point.size(); ++k) {
6340  double value = point[k];
6341 
6342  // Check if maximum value is still valid
6343  if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMaxPoint[k], getTol())) {
6344  --m_boxMaxCounter[k];
6345  if (m_boxMaxCounter[k] == 0) {
6346  setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
6347  }
6348  } else if (value > m_boxMaxPoint[k]) {
6349  assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
6350  setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
6351  }
6352 
6353  // Update minimum value
6354  if (utils::DoubleFloatingEqual()(value, m_boxMinPoint[k], getTol())) {
6355  --m_boxMinCounter[k];
6356  if (m_boxMinCounter[k] == 0) {
6357  setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
6358  }
6359  } else if (value < m_boxMinPoint[k]) {
6360  assert(false && "Bounding box is in inconsistent state.");
6361  setBoundingBoxDirty(true);
6362  }
6363  }
6364 }
6365 
6372 ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> PatchKernel::getElementVertexCoordinates(const Element &element) const
6373 {
6374  // Get the vertices ids
6375  ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
6376  const int nElementVertices = elementVertexIds.size();
6377 
6378  // Store coordinates in storage
6379  std::vector<std::array<double, 3>> storage(nElementVertices);
6380  getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds.size(), elementVertexIds.data(), storage.data());
6381 
6382  // Build the proxy vector with the coordinates
6383  ConstProxyVector<std::array<double, 3>> vertexCoordinates;
6384  vertexCoordinates.set(std::move(storage));
6385 
6386  return vertexCoordinates;
6387 }
6388

6399 }

6409 void PatchKernel::getElementVertexCoordinates(const Element &element, std::array<double, 3> *coordinates) const

6411  ConstProxyVector<long> elementVertexIds = element.getVertexIds();
6412  getVertexCoords(elementVertexIds.size(), elementVertexIds.data(), coordinates);
6413 }
6414 
6421 std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(int nBins)
6422 {
6423  return PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(m_vertices, nBins);
6424 }
6425 
6433 std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> PatchKernel::binGroupVertices(const PiercedVector<Vertex> &vertices, int nBins)
6434 {
6435  // Update bounding box
6436  updateBoundingBox();
6437 
6438  // Bin's spacing
6439  double dx = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / ((double) nBins);
6440  double dy = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / ((double) nBins);
6441  double dz = std::max(1.0e-12, m_boxMaxPoint[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / ((double) nBins);
6442 
6443  // Identify bins of vertices
6444  std::unordered_map<long, std::vector<long>> bins;
6445  for (const Vertex &vertex : vertices) {
6446  const std::array<double, 3> &coordinates = vertex.getCoords();
6447 
6448  int i = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[0] - m_boxMinPoint[0]) / dx));
6449  int j = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[1] - m_boxMinPoint[1]) / dy));
6450  int k = std::min(nBins - 1L, (long) ((coordinates[2] - m_boxMinPoint[2]) / dz));
6451 
6452  long binId = nBins * nBins * k + nBins * j + i;
6453  bins[binId].emplace_back(vertex.getId());
6454  }
6455 
6456  return bins;
6457 }
6458 
6464 void PatchKernel::translate(const std::array<double, 3> &translation)
6465 {
6466  // Translate the patch
6467  for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
6468  vertex.translate(translation);
6469  }
6470 
6471  // Update the bounding box
6472  if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
6473  m_boxMinPoint += translation;
6474  m_boxMaxPoint += translation;
6475  }
6476 }
6477 
6485 void PatchKernel::translate(double sx, double sy, double sz)
6486 {
6487  translate({{sx, sy, sz}});
6488 }
6489 
6497 void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling)
6498 {
6499  scale(scaling, m_boxMinPoint);
6500 }
6501 
6508 void PatchKernel::scale(const std::array<double, 3> &scaling, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
6509 {
6510  // Scale the patch
6511  for (auto &vertex : m_vertices) {
6512  vertex.scale(scaling, center);
6513  }
6514 
6515  // Update the bounding box
6516  if (!isBoundingBoxFrozen() || isBoundingBoxDirty()) {
6517  for (int k = 0; k < 3; ++k) {
6518  m_boxMinPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMinPoint[k] - center[k]);
6519  m_boxMaxPoint[k] = center[k] + scaling[k] * (m_boxMaxPoint[k] - center[k]);
6520  }
6521  }
6522 }
6523 
6531 void PatchKernel::scale(double scaling)
6532 {
6533  scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, m_boxMinPoint);
6534 }
6535 
6542 void PatchKernel::scale(double scaling, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
6543 {
6544  scale({{scaling, scaling, scaling}}, center);
6545 }
6546 
6554 void PatchKernel::scale(double sx, double sy, double sz)
6555 {
6556  scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, m_boxMinPoint);
6557 }
6558 
6569 void PatchKernel::scale(double sx, double sy, double sz, const std::array<double, 3> &center)
6570 {
6571  scale({{sx, sy, sz}}, center);
6572 }

6644 
6653 void PatchKernel::extractEnvelope(PatchKernel &envelope) const
6654 {
6655 
6656  // ====================================================================== //
6657  // RESIZE DATA STRUCTURES //
6658  // ====================================================================== //
6659  envelope.reserveVertices(envelope.getVertexCount() + countFreeVertices());
6660  envelope.reserveCells(envelope.getCellCount() + countFreeFaces());
6661 
6662  // ====================================================================== //
6663  // LOOP OVER CELLS //
6664  // ====================================================================== //
6665  std::unordered_map<long, long> vertexMap;
6666  for (const Cell &cell : m_cells) {
6667  int nCellFaces = cell.getFaceCount();
6668  for (int i = 0; i < nCellFaces; ++i) {
6669  if (!cell.isFaceBorder(i)) {
6670  continue;
6671  }
6672 
6673  // Add face vertices to the envelope and get face
6674  // connectivity in the envelope
6675  ConstProxyVector<long> faceConnect = cell.getFaceConnect(i);
6676  int nFaceVertices = faceConnect.size();
6677 
6678  std::unique_ptr<long[]> faceEnvelopeConnect = std::unique_ptr<long[]>(new long[nFaceVertices]);
6679  for (int j = 0; j < nFaceVertices; ++j) {
6680  long vertexId = faceConnect[j];
6681 
6682  // If the vertex is not yet in the envelope
6683  // add it.
6684  if (vertexMap.count(vertexId) == 0) {
6685  const Vertex &vertex = getVertex(vertexId);
6686  VertexIterator envelopeVertex = envelope.addVertex(vertex);
6687  vertexMap[vertexId] = envelopeVertex->getId();
6688  }
6689 
6690  // Update face ace connectivity in the envelope
6691  faceEnvelopeConnect[j] = vertexMap.at(vertexId);
6692  }
6693 
6694  // Add face to envelope
6695  ElementType faceType = cell.getFaceType(i);
6696  envelope.addCell(faceType, std::move(faceEnvelopeConnect));
6697  }
6698  }
6699 }
6700 
6708 void PatchKernel::displayTopologyStats(std::ostream &out, unsigned int padding) const
6709 {
6710  std::string indent = std::string(padding, ' ');
6711 
6712  // ====================================================================== //
6713  // VERTEX STATS //
6714  // ====================================================================== //
6715  out << indent<< "Vertices --------------------------------" << std::endl;
6716  out << indent<< " # vertices " << getVertexCount() << std::endl;
6717  out << indent<< " # orphan vertices " << countOrphanVertices() << std::endl;
6718  out << indent<< " # free vertices " << countFreeVertices() << std::endl;
6719  //out << indent<< " # free vertices " << countDoubleVertices() << std::endl;
6720 
6721  // ====================================================================== //
6722  // FACE STATS //
6723  // ====================================================================== //
6724  out << indent<< "Faces -----------------------------------" << std::endl;
6725  out << indent<< " # faces " << countFaces() << std::endl;
6726  out << indent<< " # free faces " << countFreeFaces() << std::endl;
6727 
6728  // ====================================================================== //
6729  // CELLS STATS //
6730  // ====================================================================== //
6731  out << indent<< "Cells -----------------------------------" << std::endl;
6732  out << indent<< " # cells " << getCellCount() << std::endl;
6733  out << indent<< " # orphan cells " << countOrphanCells() << std::endl;
6734  out << indent<< " # free cells " << countFreeCells() << std::endl;
6735  //out << indent<< " # free vertices " << countDoubleCells() << std::endl;
6736 }

6824  return CellConstRange(cellConstBegin(), cellConstEnd());
6825 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6826  } else if (m_vtkWriteTarget == WRITE_TARGET_CELLS_INTERNAL) {

6833 
6844 void PatchKernel::flushData(std::fstream &stream, const std::string &name, VTKFormat format)
6845 {
6846  assert(format == VTKFormat::APPENDED);
6847  BITPIT_UNUSED(format);
6848 
6849  if (name == "Points") {
6850  for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != vertexConstEnd(); ++itr) {
6851  std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
6852  long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
6853  if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
6854  const Vertex &vertex = m_vertices.rawAt(vertexRawId);
6855  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vertex.getCoords());
6856  }
6857  }
6858  } else if (name == "offsets") {
6859  long offset = 0;
6860  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6861  offset += cell.getVertexCount();
6862  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, offset);
6863  }
6864  } else if (name == "types") {
6865  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6866  VTKElementType VTKType;
6867  switch (cell.getType()) {
6868 
6869  case ElementType::VERTEX:
6870  VTKType = VTKElementType::VERTEX;
6871  break;
6872 
6873  case ElementType::LINE:
6874  VTKType = VTKElementType::LINE;
6875  break;
6876 
6877  case ElementType::TRIANGLE:
6878  VTKType = VTKElementType::TRIANGLE;
6879  break;
6880 
6881  case ElementType::PIXEL:
6882  VTKType = VTKElementType::PIXEL;
6883  break;
6884 
6885  case ElementType::QUAD:
6886  VTKType = VTKElementType::QUAD;
6887  break;
6888 
6889  case ElementType::POLYGON:
6890  VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYGON;
6891  break;
6892 
6893  case ElementType::TETRA:
6894  VTKType = VTKElementType::TETRA;
6895  break;
6896 
6897  case ElementType::VOXEL:
6898  VTKType = VTKElementType::VOXEL;
6899  break;
6900 
6901  case ElementType::HEXAHEDRON:
6902  VTKType = VTKElementType::HEXAHEDRON;
6903  break;
6904 
6905  case ElementType::WEDGE:
6906  VTKType = VTKElementType::WEDGE;
6907  break;
6908 
6909  case ElementType::PYRAMID:
6910  VTKType = VTKElementType::PYRAMID;
6911  break;
6912 
6913  case ElementType::POLYHEDRON:
6914  VTKType = VTKElementType::POLYHEDRON;
6915  break;
6916 
6917  default:
6918  VTKType = VTKElementType::UNDEFINED;
6919  break;
6920 
6921  }
6922 
6923  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, (int) VTKType);
6924  }
6925  } else if (name == "connectivity") {
6926  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6927  ConstProxyVector<long> cellVertexIds = cell.getVertexIds();
6928  const int nCellVertices = cell.getVertexCount();
6929  for (int k = 0; k < nCellVertices; ++k) {
6930  long vertexId = cellVertexIds[k];
6931  long vtkVertexId = m_vtkVertexMap.at(vertexId);
6932  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vtkVertexId);
6933  }
6934  }
6935  } else if (name == "faces") {
6936  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6937  if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
6938  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, (long) 0);
6939  } else {
6940  std::vector<long> faceStream = cell.getFaceStream();
6941  Cell::renumberFaceStream(m_vtkVertexMap, &faceStream);
6942  int faceStreamSize = faceStream.size();
6943  for (int k = 0; k < faceStreamSize; ++k) {
6944  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, faceStream[k]);
6945  }
6946  }
6947  }
6948  } else if (name == "faceoffsets") {
6949  long offset = 0;
6950  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6951  if (cell.getDimension() <= 2 || cell.hasInfo()) {
6952  offset += 1;
6953  } else {
6954  offset += cell.getFaceStreamSize();
6955  }
6956 
6957  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, offset);
6958  }
6959  } else if (name == "cellIndex") {
6960  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6961  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, cell.getId());
6962  }
6963  } else if (name == "PID") {
6964  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6965  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, cell.getPID());
6966  }
6967  } else if (name == "vertexIndex") {
6968  for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != vertexConstEnd(); ++itr) {
6969  std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
6970  long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
6971  if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
6972  long vertexId = itr.getId();
6973  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, vertexId);
6974  }
6975  }
6976 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
6977  } else if (name == "cellGlobalIndex") {
6978  PatchNumberingInfo numberingInfo(this);
6979  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6980  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, numberingInfo.getCellGlobalId(cell.getId()));
6981  }
6982  } else if (name == "cellRank") {
6983  for (const Cell &cell : getVTKCellWriteRange()) {
6984  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, getCellRank(cell.getId()));
6985  }
6986  } else if (name == "vertexRank") {
6987  for (VertexConstIterator itr = vertexConstBegin(); itr != vertexConstEnd(); ++itr) {
6988  std::size_t vertexRawId = itr.getRawIndex();
6989  long vertexVTKId = m_vtkVertexMap.rawAt(vertexRawId);
6990  if (vertexVTKId != Vertex::NULL_ID) {
6991  genericIO::flushBINARY(stream, getVertexRank(itr.getId()));
6992  }
6993  }
6994 #endif
6995  }
6996 }
6997 
7003 void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberVertices(long offset)
7004 {
7005  // Renumber vertices
7006  std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_vertices, offset);
7007 
7008  // Renumber cell connectivity
7009  for(Cell &cell : m_cells) {
7010  cell.renumberVertices(map);
7011  }
7012 
7013  // Renumber interface connectivity
7014  for(Interface &interface : getInterfaces()) {
7015  interface.renumberVertices(map);
7016  }
7017 }
7018 
7024 void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberCells(long offset)
7025 {
7026  // Renumber cells
7027  std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_cells, offset);
7028 
7029  // Renumber cell adjacencies
7030  for (auto &cell: m_cells) {
7031  long *adjacencies = cell.getAdjacencies();
7032  int nCellAdjacencies = cell.getAdjacencyCount();
7033  for (int i = 0; i < nCellAdjacencies; ++i) {
7034  long &neighId = adjacencies[i];
7035  neighId = map[neighId];
7036  }
7037  }
7038 
7039  // Renumber interface owner and neighbour
7040  for (Interface &interface: m_interfaces) {
7041  long ownerId = interface.getOwner();
7042  int ownerFace = interface.getOwnerFace();
7043  interface.setOwner(map.at(ownerId), ownerFace);
7044 
7045  long neighId = interface.getNeigh();
7046  if (neighId >= 0) {
7047  int neighFace = interface.getNeighFace();
7048  interface.setNeigh(map.at(neighId), neighFace);
7049  }
7050  }
7051 
7052  // Renumber last internal and first ghost markers
7053  if (m_lastInternalCellId >= 0) {
7054  m_lastInternalCellId = map.at(m_lastInternalCellId);
7055  }
7056 
7057 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7058  if (m_firstGhostCellId >= 0) {
7059  m_firstGhostCellId = map.at(m_firstGhostCellId);
7060  }
7061 #endif
7062 
7063 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7064  // Update partitioning information
7065  if (isPartitioned()) {
7066  updatePartitioningInfo(true);
7067  }
7068 #endif
7069 }
7070 
7076 void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(long offset)
7077 {
7078  // Renumber interfaces
7079  std::unordered_map<long, long > map = consecutiveItemRenumbering(m_interfaces, offset);
7080 
7081  // Renumber cell interfaces
7082  for (Cell &cell: m_cells) {
7083  long *interfaces = cell.getInterfaces();
7084  int nCellInterfaces = cell.getInterfaceCount();
7085  for (int i = 0; i < nCellInterfaces; ++i) {
7086  long &interfaceId = interfaces[i];
7087  interfaceId = map.at(interfaceId);
7088  }
7089  }
7090 }
7091 
7100 void PatchKernel::consecutiveRenumber(long vertexOffset, long cellOffset, long interfaceOffset)
7101 {
7102  consecutiveRenumberVertices(vertexOffset);
7103  consecutiveRenumberCells(cellOffset);
7104  consecutiveRenumberInterfaces(interfaceOffset);
7105 }
7106 
7112 int PatchKernel::getDumpVersion() const
7113 {
7114  const int KERNEL_DUMP_VERSION = 11;
7115 
7116  return (KERNEL_DUMP_VERSION + _getDumpVersion());
7117 }
7118 
7128 bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream)
7129 {
7130  // Update the patch
7131  update();
7132 
7133  // Dump the patch
7134  const PatchKernel *constPatch = this;
7135  return constPatch->dump(stream);
7136 }
7137 
7149 bool PatchKernel::dump(std::ostream &stream) const
7150 {
7151  // Dumping a dirty patch is not supported.
7152  bool dirty = isDirty(true);
7153  assert(!dirty && "Dumping a patch that is not up-to-date is not supported.");
7154  if (dirty) {
7155  return false;
7156  }
7157 
7158  // Version
7159  utils::binary::write(stream, getDumpVersion());
7160 
7161  // Generic information
7162  utils::binary::write(stream, m_id);
7163  utils::binary::write(stream, m_dimension);
7164  utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtk.getName());
7165 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7166  utils::binary::write(stream, m_haloSize);
7167 #else
7168  utils::binary::write(stream, 0);
7169 #endif
7170 
7171  // Spawn status
7172  utils::binary::write(stream, m_spawnStatus);
7173 
7174  // Adaption status
7175  utils::binary::write(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
7176 
7177  // Partition status
7178 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7179  utils::binary::write(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
7180 #else
7181  utils::binary::write(stream, PARTITIONING_UNSUPPORTED);
7182 #endif
7183 
7184  // Adjacencies build strategy
7185  utils::binary::write(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
7186 
7187  // Dump interfaces build strategy
7188  utils::binary::write(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
7189 
7190  // VTK data
7191  utils::binary::write(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
7192 
7193  // Specific dump
7194  _dump(stream);
7195 
7196  // Geometric tolerance
7197  utils::binary::write(stream, (int) m_toleranceCustom);
7198  if (m_toleranceCustom) {
7199  utils::binary::write(stream, m_tolerance);
7200  }
7201 
7202  // Index generators
7203  m_vertexIdGenerator.dump(stream);
7204  m_cellIdGenerator.dump(stream);
7205  m_interfaceIdGenerator.dump(stream);
7206 
7207  // The patch has been dumped successfully
7208  return true;
7209 }
7210 
7218 void PatchKernel::restore(std::istream &stream, bool reregister)
7219 {
7220  // Reset the patch
7221  reset();
7222 
7223  // Version
7224  int version;
7225  utils::binary::read(stream, version);
7226  if (version != getDumpVersion()) {
7227  throw std::runtime_error ("The version of the file does not match the required version");
7228  }
7229 
7230  // Id
7231  int id;
7232  utils::binary::read(stream, id);
7233  if (reregister) {
7234  patch::manager().unregisterPatch(this);
7235  patch::manager().registerPatch(this, id);
7236  }
7237 
7238  // Dimension
7239  int dimension;
7240  utils::binary::read(stream, dimension);
7241  setDimension(dimension);
7242 
7243  // Name
7244  std::string name;
7245  utils::binary::read(stream, name);
7246  m_vtk.setName(name);
7247 
7248  // Halo size
7249 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7250  utils::binary::read(stream, m_haloSize);
7251 #else
7252  int dummyHaloSize;
7253  utils::binary::read(stream, dummyHaloSize);
7254 #endif
7255 
7256  // Spawn status
7257  utils::binary::read(stream, m_spawnStatus);
7258 
7259  // Adaption status
7260  utils::binary::read(stream, m_adaptionStatus);
7261 
7262  // Partition status
7263 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7264  utils::binary::read(stream, m_partitioningStatus);
7265 #else
7266  PartitioningStatus dummyPartitioningStatus;
7267  utils::binary::read(stream, dummyPartitioningStatus);
7268 #endif
7269 
7270  // Adjacencies build strategy
7271  utils::binary::read(stream, m_adjacenciesBuildStrategy);
7272 
7273  // Interfaces build strategy
7274  utils::binary::read(stream, m_interfacesBuildStrategy);
7275 
7276  // VTK data
7277  utils::binary::read(stream, m_vtkWriteTarget);
7278 
7279  // Specific restore
7280  _restore(stream);
7281 
7282 #if BITPIT_ENABLE_MPI==1
7283  // Update partitioning information
7284  if (isPartitioned()) {
7285  updatePartitioningInfo(true);
7286  }
7287 #endif
7288 
7289  // Geometric tolerance
7290  int hasCustomTolerance;
7291  utils::binary::read(stream, hasCustomTolerance);
7292  if (hasCustomTolerance) {
7293  double tolerance;
7294  utils::binary::read(stream, tolerance);
7295  setTol(tolerance);
7296  } else {
7297  resetTol();
7298  }
7299 
7300  // Index generators
7301  m_vertexIdGenerator.restore(stream);
7302  m_cellIdGenerator.restore(stream);
7303  m_interfaceIdGenerator.restore(stream);
7304 }
7305 
7312 void PatchKernel::mergeAdaptionInfo(std::vector<adaption::Info> &&source, std::vector<adaption::Info> &destination)
7313 {
7314  if (source.empty()) {
7315  return;
7316  } else if (destination.empty()) {
7317  destination.swap(source);
7318  return;
7319  }
7320 
7321  throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to merge the adaption info.");
7322 }
7323 
7324 }
